TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class HtmlControl : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HtmlControl extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor

Docs.summary: Defines the methods, properties, and events common to all HTML server controls in the ASP.NET page framework.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class provides common properties inherited by all HTML server control classes. A new instance of the class is not created directly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using default values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is used to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class using default values.
> [!NOTE] > A new instance of this class is not created directly. This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The "span" literal string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string tag) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that specifies the tag name of the control.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified tag.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is used to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> class using the specified tag.
> [!NOTE] > A new instance of this class is not created directly. This constructor is called from the constructor of other HTML control classes to initialize properties defined in this class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The value of the `tag` parameter.|

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all attribute name and value pairs expressed on a server control tag within the ASP.NET page.
Docs.value: A object that contains all attribute name and value pairs expressed on a server control tag within the Web page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to programmatically access the attributes of the HTML server control. All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
HTML attributes are treated by the .NET Framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong.
For additional information on the attributes collection, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection?displayProperty=fullName> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Attributes%2A> property to determine the attributes of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[Classic HtmlControl.Attributes Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Attributes Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[Classic HtmlControl.Attributes Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Attributes Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Web.UI.ControlCollection CreateControlCollection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new object to hold the child controls (both literal and server) of the server control.
Docs.returns: A object to contain the current server control's child server controls.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the HTML server control is disabled.
Docs.value: if the control is disabled; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the browser, a disabled element or control is read-only, with the following added restrictions: its value is not submitted with the form, the element or control cannot receive focus, and the element or control is skipped when navigating the document by tabbing.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Disabled%2A> property to programmatically enable and disable an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputButton> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[Classic HtmlControl.Disabled Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Disabled Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[Classic HtmlControl.Disabled Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Disabled Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAttribute(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the attribute. This argument is case-insensitive.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of the named attribute on the control.
Docs.returns: The value of this attribute on the element, as a value. If the specified attribute does not exist on this element, returns an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method to access an attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> server control. All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. HTML attributes are treated by the ASP.NET page framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong. The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method's `name` parameter is case-insensitive.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void Render(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Docs.summary: Writes content to render on a client to the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Render%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method and passes the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderAttributes(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The that receives the rendered content.
Docs.summary: Renders the control's attributes into the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderAttributes%2A> method writes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderAttributes%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderBeginTag(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The that receives the rendered content.
Docs.summary: Renders the opening HTML tag of the control into the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method renders the opening angle bracket (\<), followed by the control's tag name, attributes, and a closing angle bracket (>).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> control.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void SetAttribute (string name, string value);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAttribute(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the attribute to set.
The value to set the attribute to.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the named attribute on the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method to set an attribute on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> server control. All HTML server controls store their attributes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
HTML attributes are treated by the ASP.NET page framework as properties on the HTML server control to which they belong. The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method's `name` parameter is case-insensitive.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all cascading style sheet (CSS) properties applied to a specified HTML server control in the ASP.NET file.
Docs.value: A object that contains the style properties for the HTML server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to programmatically access the style properties of the HTML server control.
For additional information on the CSS style collection, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection?displayProperty=fullName> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.Style%2A> property to determine the style properties of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[Classic HtmlControl.Style Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Style Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[Classic HtmlControl.Style Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.Style Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance string System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.GetAttribute(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see .
Docs.returns: The value of this attribute on the element, as a value. If the specified attribute does not exist on this element, returns an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IAttributeAccessor%23GetAttribute%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.GetAttribute%2A> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor.SetAttribute(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the attribute to set.
The value to set the attribute to.
Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IAttributeAccessor%23SetAttribute%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.SetAttribute%2A> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the element name of a tag that contains a attribute and value pair.
Docs.value: The element name of the specified tag.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to programmatically determine the element name of the HTML server control. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A> property of the server-side `<div id="myDiv" runat=server>` element contains the value "div".
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A> property to programmatically determine the element name of a tag.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[Classic HtmlControl.TagName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.TagName Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[Classic HtmlControl.TagName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HtmlControl.TagName Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the view state is case-sensitive.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.ViewStateIgnoresCase%2A> property overrides the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewStateIgnoresCase%2A> property to always return `true`, indicating that the controls that inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl> save view state without taking case into account.
